info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 27 at 8:38PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN HARDIN...EAST CENTRAL POPE...WEST CENTRAL CRITTENDEN AND NORTHERN LIVINGSTON COUNTIES... At 837 PM CDT, two severe thunderstorms were located near Rosiclare, Illinois, and near Salem, Kentucky, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. Locations impacted include... Rosiclare, Salem, Golconda, Joy, Elizabethtown, and Carrsville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
